result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/Sentencing Hearing held on 4/8/2015 before Judge Huber
Plea/Sentencing Hearing held on 4/8/2015 before Judge Huber

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 3:08 p.m. 
**Includes 15CM16, 15CM192 & 15CM242**
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears in person with Attorney John Zich.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.  VRCW. 
State moves to: 15CM16- delete domestic abuse enhancer on Ct.3- Criminal Damage to Property (Domestic Abuse), DRI Ct.4- Neglecting a Child & DRI Ct.5- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse)
15CM192- DRI Ct.1- Bail Jumping (Misd)
15CM242- DRI Ct.2- Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: 15CM16- Ct.1- Criminal Trespass to Dwelling (Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY
                            Ct.2- Criminal Damage to Property (Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY
                            Ct.3- Criminal Damage to Property>>GUILTY
15CM242- Ct.1- Disorderly Conduct (Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY
                   Ct.3- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>GUILTY
                   Ct.4- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>GUILTY
                   Ct.5- Bail Jumping (Misd)>>GUILTY
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 15CM16 Ct.1, 2 and 3 & 15CM242 Ct.1,3,4 & 5- SWH 3 years probation concurrent to each other. CONDITIONS: 15CM16 Ct.1 only- 120 days MCJ w/ huber for work, treatment, counseling and childcare, stay 95 days for rules violations, 25 days to be served, no contact with J.L. unless approved by agent & restitution to J.L. in the amount of $278.00. CONDITIONS on all counts: Complete LEAP program, complete SAFE program, AODA and any follow up, absolute sobriety, participate in any counseling as deemed appropriate by agent, GFE to obtain/maintain full time employment, schooling, childcare and/or a combination and if not, complete 10 hours CS per week, CC & 3 domestic abuse surcharges, DNA surcharges. 
Adj: 3:20 p.m.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 10:11 a.m. 
**Includes 15CM16, 15CM192 & 15CM242**
State appears by ADA Michael Puerner. Defendant appears with Attorney John Zich.
Parties have not reached an agreement. 
PTC set for February 25th, 2015 at 2:30 p.m. in Br.2 office. 
Adj: 10:13 a.m.

INCLUDES 15CM192, 15CM242.  $1,500.00 signature bond and $500.00 cash bond.  Shall not consume alcohol.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day Report - within 1 business day of release.   No contact with victim(s):  J.L. (NON-WAIVABLE)  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort through Wausau Police Department to retrieve any personal belongings.  Third party visitation through Family Resource Center.
